intro: Gnaphalium melanophthalmum, commonly known as the black-eyed everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale green to brown ray florets, giving it its common name. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Gnaphalium melanophthalmum is known for its resilience to drought and its ability to reseed itself, making it a hardy species in harsh climates.
